About Booking.com
At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world.
  About the Role
Booking.com began by taking hotel bookings online over 20 years ago and we’ve been shaping the travel industry ever since. Today, the Trips Business Unit is building a platform that connects all parts of the trip – from accommodation to flights, transport, tickets, tours and more - leading the evolution of Booking.com from a single-product company to a multi-product offering company with an unprecedented, personalized travel experience to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. 
  You’ll be the Principal Designer - Trips Design Foundations, helping understand, define and craft the future of the connected trip, connecting the end-to-end user experience, identifying and shaping product strategy, and continuously raise the bar for design quality across the Trips Business Unit.
  B.responsible
This role will help shape new products and services, craft and scale user interface foundations, and work closely with PX Design Foundations to ensure dissemination of design and accessibility standards across the Trips Business Unit. Producing designs that serve as benchmarks for the organization as a whole and partnering closely with the design, product, research, technology and UX writing leaders to drive future development of key products and services. You will guide the design of user experiences, product strategy or features through leadership and mentorship of designers, with a commitment to creating simple, coherent, elegant and compelling experiences that deliver real value to our users. 
  Important aspects of the job include:
  Craft & Delivery
Facilitate the long-term design vision for Trips by developing innovative new ideas and solutions, leading creation and development of “the vision” collaboratively or independently with peers in design, research and product.
Help shape new products and services and detail the strategic direction of those new paths in order to drive forward progress. Fostering understanding, building consensus, and ensuring commitment to long-term product and design vision across multiple tracks and teams
Connect the dots between teams and facilitate collaborative processes to provide continuous design direction and innovation. .
Shares expert knowledge of user flows, product features, and underlying technologies across teams and tracks.
Contributes to advancements in Booking.com's design and development principles, standards, components, and practices.
Displays a commitment to design excellence and defines exceptional quality for their fellow designers via all aspects of the work they do.
They produce designs that serve as benchmarks for the organization as a whole, leave no element unaccounted for, and drive future development of various products and services.
Drives consistent adoption and adherence to relevant design standards and principles. 
Support for the wider Trips and Design Foundation strategic objectives to enhance the user experience and drive consistent product experiences on all platforms.
Demonstrate awareness of current and upcoming trends in market, technology and design; Sharing this knowledge widely and encouraging others to learn. 
Actively seek out, request, and contribute to the creation and collection of data to better understand the customer experience and to help inform product and design decisions.
  Design & Experience Strategy
Proactively partner with managers, leads, principals, directors in design, product and technology to guide and influence strategic decisions made across Trips horizontal and vertical organizations; Align with other leaders to drive larger design and product initiatives.
Demonstrate fluent understanding of track area's business models and strategies; Actively contributes to strategy through collaboration with other track leadership and managers. 
Aligns with other teams’ missions and objectives through collaboration across teams, disciplines and levels.
Thought partner for Product teams to define, shape, and deliver app and web roadmaps.
Acts as a consistent advocate for end user needs and perspectives in product area discussions, reviews, and critiques. 
Champions adherence and consistency to established design and UX copy standards and guidelines across their area of business at all levels and disciplines. 
Actively engages with other managers and departments in order to improve management processes, contribute to overall performance evaluation and improvement.
Communicates across business units to identify company-level challenges and opportunities and builds internal and external partnerships to enable collaboration across designers, teams, and business units.
Deliver company level or external industry communication on design, strategy, or processes at Booking.com, new products, and new business initiatives; Provides design leadership, craft, process, or strategy advice and counsel for broader business unit and company-level initiatives.
Mentor and coach individual designers to improve craft, deliverables, process, communication, and career advancement.
Cultivates designer skill, mentors and coaches individual designers to improve craft, deliverables, process, communication, and career advancement.
Promotes their domain across the company in order to spread awareness and create a more consistent user experience
  B.skilled
8 to 12 years individual contributor design experience, preferably in travel, marketplaces & ecommerce, SaaS, media, retail, etc, in customer-orientated user experience design organizations 
Experience shipping successful products on multiple platforms using scalable frameworks such as design systems and machine learning frameworks.
Extensive knowledge of design processes 
Demonstrate advanced understanding and application of user-centered design concepts, methods, and techniques to facilitate their use, enable and advance quality design and outcomes.
Documented creative ability to develop ideas, flows, designs and propositions to engage customers 
Strong theoretical and practical user-centred design skills 
Experience and knowledge of A/B and multivariate testing processes 
Knowledge of Lean UX, Lean startup, Design Thinking, and dual track agile 
Excellent stakeholder management experience
A proven communicator who can influence and cooperate with people at all levels
Strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful
Solution oriented and result driven, analytical skills and data-informed mindset
Bachelor’s degree in Design, HCI, Computer Science, Library Science, or a related field or 5 years of progressively responsible experience in the specialty as equivalent
  B.offered
Full relocation support for you and your family (if the case) to move to Amsterdam - one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe. We have fine-tuned this process by successfully relocating 300+ Technology professionals to Amsterdam in the last year alone!
  Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real time impact of your work on millions of travellers worldwide
Working in a fast paced and performance driven culture
Opportunity to utilise technical expertise, leadership capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit
Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions
Technical, behavioural and interpersonal competence advancement via on-the-job opportunities, experimental projects, hackathons, conferences and active community participation

Finance Analyst (FP&A)
Manchester 
  About the company 
Booking.com Transport Ltd is part of the Trips Business Unit at Booking.com. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners, and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world. 
The Trips business unit will bridge the Booking.com of today with the Booking.com of tomorrow, leading the evolution from a single-product company to a multi-product offering company with an unprecedented, personalised travel experience at the heart of its success. 
  About the role
In this role you are part of a dynamic and fast-paced team reporting to the Corporate FP&A Manager of the Trips Business Unit of Booking.com.
The Trips Corporate FP&A team are responsible for the overall financial planning & analysis for “Everything but the stay’ at Booking.com: Car Rental, Taxis, Public Transport, Attractions, Flights and Insurance verticals.
You will play an important part in coordinating and consolidating the financial performance of the separate verticals to provide senior management with a deep understanding of variances in actual performance versus plan, as well as forward looking financial plans and forecasts for the Trips Business Unit. 
As a successful team member, you will have a good understanding of financial principles and financial systems. You are looking to apply your skill set to make an impact and become a strong collaborator across the different FP&A teams in the wider organisation and beyond. You are detail-orientated and naturally analytical, excelling at showcasing logical thinking when compiling, analysing, and presenting financial data and analysis. You are able to prioritise your workload and you can effectively balance and navigate time-sensitive and clashing requests or priorities.
Due to the rapidly evolving travel market and recent industry disruptions, as well as the past history of rapid growth of our business in the last 2 decades, the tasks and duties of this role will evolve over time. You will be keen to develop and grow within the role and challenge yourself to take on additional projects and responsibilities as they present themselves
Your responsibilities
Consolidation of financial plans for each of the Trip verticals including production of the P&L on a rolling 3 year basis;
Ownership of the monthly production of the P&L - Actual vs Plan Reporting, through effective collaboration with Group FP&A & Accounting on completion of the monthly financial close;
Lead production of the monthly management accounts pack; using the ability to effectively summarise and pin-point the relevant data-points that will update management and support decision making;
Recurring report production and variance analysis, as well as continuously seeking ways to improve existing reporting to fit with evolving requests from senior management;
Effectively manage the intercompany balances and communications between Trips FP&A and Group FP&A
Support on ad-hoc commercially focused projects, providing relevant insights, reporting and financial impact information
Your skills and experience
3+ years’ experience in a Corporate and/or Reporting or similar role;
Strong working knowledge of the P&L and general accounting;
Prior experience in a large organisation/group with intercompany financial movements
CIMA / ACCA / ACA or equivalent qualification
Good knowledge of Excel and/or Google suite;
Analytical mindset and a strong desire to aid data-driven decision making;
Excellent business partnering and communication skills;
Strong commercial acumen;
Sees the headlines with attention on the details;
Strong team-working skills with ability to work independently;
Confident presenting findings in an effective, structured and actionable way to a wide set of audiences with varying levels of understanding
Comfortable working in cross-functional teams and working in an unstructured environment;
Knowledge of financial systems e.g. Anaplan, SAP and One Stream is a plus
  Benefits
25 vacation days (rising to 28) to go exploring
Generous accommodation discount, so you can explore for less
Bonus package 
Pension with up to 10% matched company contribution
Free breakfast and subsidised staff restaurant with Starbucks coffee
Huge learning and development platform tailored to you
Shopping and leisure discounts through Perkbox
Interest free travel loans/discounted car parking
Competitive maternity/paternity/adoption leave
Flexible working, including working from home
Mental health first-aiders and free face-to-face support

Booking Holdings Romania is a Center of Excellence based in Bucharest, Romania and was created to support the increasing business demands of the Booking Holdings Brands. The Center of Excellence provides access to specialized and highly skilled talent, leading industry best practices, and collaboration opportunities across all of our Brands.
As part of our Booking Holdings Romania team, you will have the opportunity to be a part of the world’s leading provider of online travel, with a mission of making it easier for everyone to experience the world through six-primary consumer facing brands: Booking.com, Priceline, Agoda, KAYAK, OpenTable and Rentalcars.com.
  About the role
Booking Holdings is looking for an experienced professional  to lead the Finance and Accounting function at our delivery center in Bucharest, Romania. Booking Holdings will build technical expertise within these centers, referred to as ‘Centers of Excellence (COE)’ to serve various brands and entities within the Holding portfolio. The leadership role will largely centered around establishing and overseeing key accounting activities. Additionally, the role will support the creation of financial management processes as the center scales up to a steady state. The role will involve working closely with the COE Leader and other corporate stakeholders (HR, Program Management etc.) in developing and executing accounting, internal controls, planning, and forecasting activities to achieve COE goals.   The focus for 2021 H2 is to support the leadership in establishing the COE, lead the set-up, operations and maturity of the accounting system at the center, design comprehensive financial reporting governance processes, and actively ensure all policies, procedures, controls, and systems facilitate compliance and scaling of the Booking Holdings’ Bucharest COE. 
  Benefits (Beyond Your Salary):
23 vacation days per year so you can explore the world
Health insurance
Meal vouchers
Performance-based bonuses to reward your hard work.
International environment full of open, creative and passionate people 
Learning and development opportunities to grow your skill-set and future career
  What You’Ll Be Doing:
There will be many measures of success to the role, however, at a high-level they fall into the following key areas. Requiring a very hands-on approach in the startup phase but will mature into a more established team over time.
Lead All Accounting Activities
Generating financial reports using income and expenditure data, creating budgets, bookkeeping ledgers, business plans and financial statements
Tax planning with reference to current legislation
Ensure proper record keeping related to any tax incentives (individual or corporate) that are enabled
Filing and remitting taxes and other financial obligations (e.g. VAT, WHT, etc.)
Ensure bookkeeping and accounting in accordance with local and regional laws and guidelines, company policies and compliance requirements; stay up to date on financial reporting law and best practices
Complete year-end and regular audits
Establish internal controls and guidelines for accounting transaction
Ensure compliance with Booking Holdings Accounting Policies and other guidelines issued by Booking Holdings 
  Build and Manage Financial Reporting Governance
Define and establish reporting standards and timelines for key financial data; ensure delivery of all reporting requirements according to the defined deadlines
Oversee and enhance information provided to leadership for business decisions
Respond to requests from colleagues and management in an efficient and timely manner for various types of reports and analysis
Coordinate with corporate and regional Tax, Accounting, Finance, FP&A, Treasury and Audit teams
Ensure all aspects of Romanian COE are embedded into the company's financial planning process
  Monitor Day-To-Day Financial Operations
Oversee the daily management of the Center of Excellence which includes the interaction with the business partners, finance colleagues, and the direct supervision of the COE finance team, ensuring all objectives for finance are realized
Prepare standard, ad hoc reporting, and key performance indicators (KPIs) each period for the business and finance management
Review and monitor SLA related services to identify trends and problem areas, reporting on risks and proposed corrective action or new approaches
Drive continuous improvement and simplification efforts in reporting, financial processes, and tools

Lead Planning and Forecasts
Lead the preparation of the financial forecasts and budgets for respective functions, including the identification and quantification of opportunities and risks
Proactively identify business drivers to support the budget and forecast assumption
Facilitate the negotiation and agreement of key operational metrics and inputs
Support any scope change request or any project, contributing with information for the business case
  What Skills Do You Need:
Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Accounting
CPA, CA or equivalent certification (e.g. ACCA)
Minimum 7-10 years of Finance and Accounting experience 
Minimum 5 years in a leadership role, managing a team
Previous leadership experience in a Center of Excellence, Shared Services Center, or similar customer-facing type of environment will be a plus
Deep understanding of offshore COE and shared services organizations and models
Proven knowledge of bookkeeping and accounting principles, practices, standards, laws and regulations – particularly laws or regulations specific to Romanian and Eastern European Finance and Accounting law
Strong skills in reporting, budgeting, bookkeeping, tax planning 
Highly developed skills in external and internal financial reporting, application of accounting principles and tax regulations, financial decision making and internal control
Strong commercial and decision support experience in different aspects of financial management including financial planning and analyses, forecasting, and management reporting and analytics
Working knowledge of SAP and other financial tools
Strong understanding of and experience with process mapping and process improvement
Ability to motivate and develop others, including working thought other teams and managers
Proficiency in English
Strong analytical, problem solving and communication skills, and attention to detail
Why Join Us? 
  Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) is the world leader in online travel and related services, provided to customers and partners in over 220 countries and territories through six primary consumer-facing brands – Booking.com, KAYAK, priceline, agoda.com, Rentalcars.com, and OpenTable.
  The mission of Booking Holdings is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. This role with Booking Holdings Romania will be working closely with our various brands:
Booking.com: Booking.com is a global online leader in connecting travelers with the widest choice of incredible places to stay.
Priceline: Priceline is a leader in online discount travel. HQ: Norwalk, Connecticut
Agoda: Agoda is a leading global online accommodations provider based in the heart of Asia. HQ: Singapore
Rentalcars.com: Rentalcars.com is operated as part of Booking.com and offers online rental car reservation services. HQ: Manchester, England
KAYAK: KAYAK provides an online price comparison service (often referred to as a “meta-search”) that allows consumers to easily search and compare travel itineraries and prices. HQ: Stamford, Connecticut
OpenTable: OpenTable is a leading brand for booking online restaurant reservations. HQ: San Francisco, California
At Booking Holdings we help our customers to reach all corners of the earth. Our ability to provide great service rests on how well we understand our diverse customer base, which is why having a diverse team is so important to us.  We bring together employees from all walks of life and we are proud to provide the kind of inclusive environment that stimulates innovation, creativity and collaboration.

Job Title: Group Product Manager - B2B Partnerships Platform
Job Description:
Our Company
Founded in 1996 in Amsterdam, Booking.com has grown from a small Dutch start-up to one of the world’s leading digital travel companies. Part of Booking Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ: BKNG), Booking.com’s mission is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.
By investing in technology that takes the friction out of travel, Booking.com seamlessly connects millions of travelers to memorable experiences, a variety of transportation options, and incredible places to stay – from homes to hotels, and much more. As one of the world’s largest travel marketplaces for both established brands and entrepreneurs of all sizes, Booking.com enables properties around the world to reach a global audience and grow their businesses.
At Booking.com, we are all involved in making hundreds of decisions every day. The decisions we make are a reflection of our values -  they reflect what is important to us, both as individuals and as an organization. 
Booking.com was recently ranked #3 in the Financial Times’ 2021 Diversity Leaders list of European employers, and we couldn’t be more proud. It’s a great recognition for our colleagues around the world, who effortlessly work to create a welcoming and open environment in which people can connect and learn from each other. 
PARTNERSHIPS
Our Partnerships department is composed of 400+ people in 20+ countries driving a significant share of B.com’s overall business. The team is responsible for all of the demand facing B2B relationships at B.com with full accountability for the demand facing B2B platform and suite of products, business development and account management, and B2B marketing.
We have product development teams based in Amsterdam and Manchester, with central functions and operations in Amsterdam and regional account management teams globally. Constant interaction with partners at the top of their game requires a high pace of innovation, solid understanding of travel distribution and tech, and a business acumen steeped in B2B.
Please see below a short list of examples of our partners across various industries:
American Airlines
KLM
Grab
Citibank
Ctrip.com
Hopper
SABRE
Group Product Manager - B2B Partnerships Platform
This role will define product strategy and roadmap, lead a team of product managers across multiple closely coupled  initiatives and individually contribute to execute key projects. They translate business needs into product roadmaps that incorporate appropriate qualitative and quantitative research and stakeholder input.
This role reports directly to the Director of Product.
Responsibilities
Create product vision, strategy, and roadmaps that identify areas where improvement is needed; and capitalize on unmet opportunities, via actionable product initiatives.
Be deeply committed to solving customer pain points and identifying opportunities to better our experience. Collecting data as necessary to inform product direction, whether in the form of competitive intelligence, or other business metrics. Solicit and embrace critical feedback.
Build roadmaps, define success metrics for new and existing initiatives, and track them on a regular basis to ensure that all projects and existing functionality are moving towards our defined goals.
Responsible for maintaining a prioritisation framework that facilitates transparent and simple decision-making on priorities and sequencing to maximize impact on customer needs, product quality, business value while balancing technical feasibility.
Responsible for ensuring a high quality user experience with our products by applying technical awareness and understanding of technical risks.
Support and justify the chosen technical solutions and build a bridge between technical and non-technical stakeholders by ensuring the technical feature development and strategy are scoped to satisfy the short and long terms needs of the business.
Manage a team of Product Managers, inspire, help to succeed and grow them.
Skills and Qualities
8+ years experience building products
2+ years experience managing and leading product managers
Problem solver, can identify and analyze complex issues and developer clear approach solving them.
Excellent communication skills, can effectively communicate with stakeholders in different roles and levels, clearly communicate strategic vision and big picture but also specific details. Great written and presentation skills.
Strong organizational and project management skills, can manage multiple projects effectively themselves and through others. Experienced with agile methodologies.
Team player, fast learner, passionate about product and people.
We offer
This role is open to worldwide candidates. We provide assistance for you and your family with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam. We have successfully relocated thousands of technology professionals to Amsterdam.
Headquarters located in one of the most vibrant cities in Europe: Amsterdam
Performance-based company that offers 29 vacation days, career advancement, and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential
Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking Deal” including other perks and benefits
Company-sponsored family and social activities to help our employees become integrated with each other and Dutch culture
Competence advancements via online resources, trainings, on-the-job opportunities, conferences and community initiatives
Competitive compensation and benefits package
Diverse, unique colleagues from every corner of the world

At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core and innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place and the excitement of the next morning. The friends you make, the journeys you take, the sights you see and the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we can empower everyone to experience the world. 
Our IT Services Department is providing Booking.com workforce with all the systems and functionality they need to do their best work. From the laptop, Wi-Fi connection, communication channels to seamless access on all the applications being used. IT Services is responsible for delivery, service and support of this complete environment, running on  a global infrastructure spread over 100+ offices for 15K+ employees.
IT Services Operations
The IT Services Operations team finds its core in monitoring & alerting, issue handling and change support for  the Voice Communications and Network environments within the IT Services Department. The ITS Operations team is positioned within the Corporate Network track. Together with the other tracks around systems/applications/support they will add focus to the ITSM processes Incident-, Problem- and Change management. With new responsibilities like Major Incident Management, proactive communication and change coordination they will bring the ITS service-experience to the next level.
Manager Operations IT Services
As the Manager Operations you will lead the ITS Operations team with 5 to 10 employees. The team is at the start of its journey and both the team itself and its services will face a lot of exciting challenges and growth. Next to the Operations Management itself, the definition, coordination and implementation of the ITSM processes and its environments like ServiceNow, monitoring and reporting, will be a major part of your job.
Are you as passionate about Operations as we are, proactive, an excellent communicator and motivator? Does ITSM have no secrets for you? Then we have a great opportunity for you!
B.responsible
The Booking.com workforce, your customer, is always proactively informed about the quality and status of the products and services they use (Service Catalog - Customer Products).
The ITSM processes and its activities are monitored and reported on towards management and customers (Service Levels)
Incidents and potential incidents are actively managed by the team, from monitoring to the outage report (RFO) and everything in between. 
Escalation management in case of major breaches.
Close collaboration between related departments (IT-Support and Engineering groups) to constantly optimize the quality of our processes, workflows and services.
Manage improvement initiatives on the technical and administrative management systems so the team can do their best work (ticket handling, monitoring & alerting, systems management, etc.)
Participate in ITS department projects to represent ITS Operations in demand, implementation and quality.
Coach and facilitate your team members on growth and quality levels around the ITSM activities.
On-Call escalation handling and hands-on technical Operations support (monitoring and configuration).
Contribute to the growth of Booking.com through recruitment efforts and proactively share your knowledge to help your colleagues grow.
Represent Booking.com values, both within the company and in the external community.
B.skilled.
Team player and should be fluent in the English language, both spoken and written.
Solution-driven attitude, capable of building a team.
Proven ability to kick-start and drive process-, technical-, business-, and people-related initiatives that improve productivity, performance, and quality.

Engineering Manager - Insurance - Front-End
Not long ago, booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was complex and time consuming. Now it is simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone.
In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more.
Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.
We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready.
Booking.com core values
●  Think customer first
●  Succeed together
●  Own It
●  Learn Forever
●  Do the Right Thin
Trips Business Unit (TBU) direction

At Booking.com we’re working to seamlessly connect every aspect of travel, and the TBU team is one of the cornerstones of our connected trip vision. We’re dedicated to helping travellers uncover the best transport options available to them around the world. To do this we need to offer the broadest selection of bookable transport options, and effortlessly match the right options to the right person at the right time. Our goal is to offer travellers the widest choice and the best customer experience no matter what transport option they choose.
About the team
As part of our Connected Trip ambition, Booking.com wants to ensure that customers have peace of mind when booking their travel - particularly in uncertain times. Part of this ambition is the delivery of insurance products to give our customers assurance that there is protection, should anything happen.
Our Transportation unit already has a mature insurance business aimed at offering its car rental customers’ this peace of mind, and we are planning to use this as a springboard on which to build further. We seek to unify our insurance resources, and build a foundation on which to deliver insurance products to all of our segments, including: Accommodations, transportation, flights and attractions.
Booking.com has ambitious growth plans for the insurance business. Example opportunities include traditional areas such as travel protection, alongside new categories, such as home-sharing protection for our vacation rental segment.
The key strategic aims are to: Build an insurance operating model that can deliver to our insurance requirements, and to use this to expand and grow a global footprint of general insurance product offerings throughout the Group. Through innovation and industry sector knowledge and single-threaded focus, the challenge is to substantially enhance the group’s customer Insurance experience and drive a profitable account.
Where we are going
Frictionless customer experience driven by data, machine learning and AI
Cloud by default with continuous delivery, infrastructure as code and automation at our core
Domain based SOA ecosystem organised around Product
Cross functional agile teams who own their products and operate in a DevOps environment
Great engineering practices with a focus on TDD and BDD principles and a strong focus on product metrics and non-functional requirements at the beginning rather than an afterthought
Our Engineering Principals 
Organised
Ethical
Deliver when we say we will
Leadership

Trust

We are looking for a superb and enthusiastic Software Engineering Manager who will lead an agile team to push the boundaries on engineering brilliant solutions and contribute to shaping our new future.  We expect you to have the energy and passion to deliver using a whole range of technologies and have a solid understanding of engineering principles.  We also expect you to take the lead and line manage a team of Engineers.  As a minimum, we expect all our Engineering Leads to have:

At Booking.com, our mission is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.
As a Talent Sourcer, you will be is responsible for building a top-of-funnel strategy for attracting passive and active top talent in for our corporate and commercial business units and specifically partner with our regional Recruiters attracting the best commercial talent across the DACH region. 
You will act as the point of contact with active and passive talent to assess their engagement and perform an initial assessment of their fit for a specific business unit, function or role. Attention to detail and creativity/innovation will be your modus operandi. You will suggest unique, sometimes niche, sourcing channels which deliver the right calibre of talent and educate the Recruiter and Hiring Manager for future success.
Tasks & Responsibilities:
Design and implement effective outbound sourcing strategies based on an understanding of the market and each specific role
Create pipelines of prequalified candidates for current and future positions with the goal of increasing the level of candidate flow and customer service to internal clients
Design top-of-funnel strategy alongside (partnering with) Recruiters, other Sourcers, Researchers and Hiring Teams, serving as the subject matter expert on the competitive landscape and on creative sourcing techniques.
Develop and drive continuous improvements that positively impact talent pipelines for current and future positions
Capture and maintain accurate market, and candidate information on our ATS, CRM and knowledge management systems so as to both facilitate the search process and our overarching Talent Intelligence initiatives
Use expertise to inform the team’s quarterly goals and rolling annual plan cycle.
Source, engage, and screen passive (and active) talent for existing roles and for future recruiting needs
Phone interview candidates for hard and soft skills, interest level, salary range, availability relocation needs, compatibility with Booking.com’s values
Prioritize building a diverse team at every step of the recruiting process, ensuring our top-of-funnel efforts and interviews provide candidates of all backgrounds with equal, unbiased consideration and opportunity.
Effectively communicate the Booking.com values and evolution to date to influence passive talent
Work with other Recruiting Team members on a variety of recruiting initiatives and programs, such as referrals drives, interview training, and recruiting marketing initiatives.
Ideal Profile & Experience
3+ years of corporate and commercial sourcing experience with in-house recruiting team, search firm, or agency. Experience in sourcing and market knowledge across the DACH region is preferred
German language skills are also preferred but not hard requirement!
Proven background in using innovative research and sourcing methods and relentless in the pursuit to hire for niche areas and ‘hard to fill’ roles.
Ability to leverage multiple recruiting channels to drive results: email, linkedin, phone or in person
Experience developing and executing candidate generation and research techniques
Experience engaging and activating passive candidates
Experience establishing & maintaining relationships with individuals at all levels of the organization & in the business community.
A successful track record of performing against quotas, deadlines, and meeting recruiting goals.
Ability to work in a fast paced environment with changing priorities (Growth mindset!)

Within the Security department at Booking.com, Security Services protects from financial loss and brand damage by strategically securing channels; assets, customers, employees, partners, brand reputation, transaction, integrity, and infrastructure - through the use of world class technical capabilities that appropriately balance the management of risk with the impact to global business operations.   
We are currently looking for a Senior Crisis Management Specialist with experience in supporting the development and delivery of crisis management programs across complex organisations. The position will offer a high degree of visibility as we drive the development of the Crisis Management program.
B.Responsible
The Crisis Management program is an integral part of the Group Resilience team who is responsible for ensuring that the organization is sufficiently equipped to anticipate, respond and recover from significant events posing a threat to our people, sites and business operations. Sitting within the wider Group Security and Resilience team, this role is instrumental in supporting the building and delivery of a world class crisis management program.
The roles primary function will be supportive; helping set up the foundational elements such as plans, policies, metrics, dashboards and supporting the development of training materials. A significant portion of the day will be spent supporting our crisis management programs  (international and enterprise) to scale the delivery and implementation of our framework.
This position requires a high degree of flexibility, independence, and the ability to problem-solve.

Excellent at digesting operational information and contributing to the uplift of incident and crisis response capabilities

JOB DESCRIPTION FOR: VP Finance (FP&A)
Our Company
Established in 1996 in Amsterdam, Booking.com has grown from a small Dutch start-up to one of the largest ecommerce companies in the world. Booking.com is the largest business within Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) and accounts for the vast majority of Booking Holdings’ total revenue. Booking Holdings is a leading Fortune 500 e-commerce conglomerate with a market cap of approximately $100 billion.
With a mission to make it easier for everyone to experience the world, Booking.com invests in digital technology that helps take the friction out of travel. Booking.com connects travelers with the world’s largest selection of incredible places to stay, including everything from apartments, vacation homes, and family-run B&Bs to 5-star luxury resorts and even tree houses. The Booking.com website and mobile apps are available in over 43 languages and customers can reach Booking.com 24/7 for assistance and support in over 43 languages. As Booking.com envisions a future in which it will serve customers a one-stop solution for all travel-related needs, we are working towards offering a fully ‘Connected Trip’, in which every aspect of the travel experience can be planned and booked through us. We are determined to build the number 1 travel brand in the world!
At Booking.com, the decisions we make are a reflection of our Values - they reflect what is important to us, both as individuals and as an organization. When they are shared, they build unity in a group. They build culture:
Think customer first. We obsess about adding value for our customers - guests, partners, colleagues - to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.
Own it. We deliver on our promises, make informed decisions and prioritize to get the important things done today.
Learn forever. We are resilient, take time to reflect, and seek to learn – from colleagues, from the outside world and from our failures.
Succeed together. We celebrate team success, through making connections, building trust and valuing the diverse perspectives of others.
Do the right thing. We get the right results the right way. For each other, our communities and the world around us.



Profile VP Finance (FP&A)
The purpose of FP&A is to provide ‘Decision Making Information’ and business partnering to the right stakeholder at the right time - whether this be for big strategic decisions via business cases or tactical day-to-day steering through performance reporting & transparency. FP&A’s stakeholders are Director level and above with operational support being handled with embedded teams throughout the organization. This role oversees  all the aspects of the business units (Accommodation, Flights, Car, Attractions, etc) and horizontal departments like Marketing, Central Technology, HR, Legal, Finance etc. Moving forward with  the strategy of the connected trip and the current organization structure, the FP&A team is at the forefront of implementing these changes to allow for the increasing complexity of decision making and transparency to happen in a timely manner.
The VP Finance works closely with the leadership team at Booking.com and leads a team of 100+ fte. (S)he reports directly to the CFO of Booking.com and has a dotted reporting line to the VP Investor Relations & FP&A at Booking Holdings.  In addition, this leader is a key partner to other key Finance leaders at Booking.com such as Accounting, Tax, and Treasury.
The finance function at Booking.com is on a transformational journey to modernize its systems, processes and data capabilities.  The VP FP&A plays a key role with respect to both the overall finance transformation and more specifically, Booking.com’s reporting and data and analytics capabilities.
  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Working with all BUs and Functional departments & future subsidiaries to prepare targets, budgets and consolidate them into one overall yearly/quarterly targets/ budget
Creating, updating, and maintaining financial models and detailed forecasts of the company’s year/3year plan
Establishing quarterly guidance to Booking Holdings, with modeling and deciding on growth rates, volumes, and projecting all variables related to financials.  In addition, collaborate closely with Booking Holdings on board presentations.
Examining and evaluating the cost-efficiency of each department, in light of what percentage of the company’s financial resources each department consumes and its impact on the bottom-line
Preparing internal reports for executive leadership and supporting their decision making to ensure they make the best use of the company’s working capital, by looking at return on investment (ROI) and comparisons with other scenarios that utilize our cash
Comparing historical results against budgets and forecasts, and performing variance analysis to explain differences in performance and make improvements going forward with regards to its operating model and partner distribution strategy
Improving and ensuring data governance/integrity on key metrics
• Determining which distribution product/channels combination in which regions generate the biggest "net contribution”
Considering opportunities for Booking.com to expand or grow in when adding new verticals. Mapping out growth plans, including capital expenditures and investments
External Reporting via Holdings; PR or various Government agencies and commissions
Manage the team and own the professional development of the FP&A department, actively upskilling the team to deal with an increasingly complex environment.
Participate in merger and acquisition activities, as needed.
  IDEAL EXPERIENCE: 
This position requires a highly experienced executive with prior public company finance experience, impeccable strategic and analytical skills, and strong leadership traits. The ideal candidate will be intellectually curious, highly collaborative, and a contributing force as the company transitions into a multi product line Online Travel Leader. The candidate is a strong communicator and a strong leader of a sizable organization (100+ fte). The candidate will handle challenging situations in a professional and balanced manner and will serve as a mentor, leader and partner across the organization. The candidate will be experienced and comfortable operating in a “dotted line” matrixed reporting model and will know how to leverage this structure.
12+ years of senior level finance leadership experience
Diverse and progressive finance experience preferred. Strong academic credentials, including a finance, accounting, controlling or other relevant degree; a finance, economics, accounting, or business qualification and/or MBA are desirable.
Experience in leading the FP&A environment for a large division or company
Experience gained in a company with revenues of $1-5 Billion+ 
Experience in technology, eCommerce or Internet and/or with rapidly growing global businesses will be a strong plus.
Experience leading teams that are dispersed across global locations and cultures, conducting business in different markets and currencies.
Experience in a matrix organization and/or in an organization with the typical global, regional and local complexities 
Experience in leading transformations; track record of successfully leading teams through transformation in flexible, less structured environments. 
Understanding of regulations, risks, and doing business in a global environment; experience living abroad is desirable.
  OTHER PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS
Financial thought leadership; ability to assimilate broad strategic & complex topics and translate them into tangible business & financial impacts
Strong managerial skills with the ability to lead a team that is dealing with tough stakeholders, tight deadlines, and big impact projects
Excellent corporate agility to collaborate and build relationships at all levels of the organization
Ability to drive change and adapt quickly in an agile environment

Booking.com is the world’s leading accommodation site, but boasts a small, start-up feel. Booking.com BV’s vision is to provide the best accommodations at the best prices for all its travellers, no matter what their travel purpose or budget may be. With over 1 million room nights booked every day in our 855,000+ accommodations worldwide, its mission is to make travel, experience and exploration accessible for everyone, everywhere. Do you want to support Booking.com BV with redefining the way travellers explore the world? Join us in beautiful Shanghai as a product manager!

User focused individual who keeps the customer at the heart of everything we do, while having strong business awareness.
Data driven. Base your decisions on facts rather than opinions.
A go-getter who isn’t afraid to get their hands dirty and dives into a project to achieve success by problem solving.
Eager to learn and aware that valuable information can come from both positive and negative results through experimentation.
Passionate about product development and constantly looking for ways to improve it.
Open minded team player with excellent communication skills.
Agile and innovative with the tenacity to thrive in a constantly changing environment.
Self-motivated and results driven with a take charge attitude to manage the development cycle of a product.
Friendly, knowledgeable, and motivational to others. Open to diversity in all shapes and sizes.

About Booking.com
At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world.
About the Role
Booking.com began by taking hotel bookings online over 20 years ago and we’ve been shaping the travel industry ever since. Today, the Trips Business Unit is building a platform that connects all parts of the trip – from accommodation to flights, transport, tickets, tours and more - leading the evolution of Booking.com from a single-product company to a multi-product offering company with an unprecedented, personalized travel experience to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. 
You’ll be the Senior Design Manager - Trips, managing designers across multidisciplinary product teams and groups in our Cars and Rides product organizations. You will work to elevate the whole of the Trips design organization as a function, guiding design processes to identify customer needs and shape product strategy, continuously raise the bar for design quality, and build high performing teams of skilled designers who craft compelling experiences that deliver real value to our users. Understanding the career development needs of your teams, the business needs of the company, and how to effectively align the two in a healthy and productive way.
B.responsible
This is a unique opportunity for a Senior Design Manager who will partner closely with the design, product, research, technology and UX writing leaders driving our Cars and Rides, as well as the wider Product Experience and Trips vertical teams. This role manages, coaches and develops a craft-focused team, and you will drive all team activities to define and design new experiences, ensuring that deliverables are on time, with acceptable quality, and aligned to product strategies. The role will confer with leaders, product owners, technology teams, and key stakeholders to research and frame problems, develop solution options, visualize experiences, and create product-ready assets that help Booking reach its user experience ambitions. 
Important aspects of the job include:
People Leadership
Lead by example through taking ownership, being proactive, and collaborating.
Nurture, grow, and develop design talent in the team; is an approachable coach and mentor. 
Leads design managers and senior design staff.
Foster a great culture that innovates, works together as a team, partners with other Booking.com com teams and roles and celebrates unified success.
Respects the Booking.com values and uses them as a guide to the way we work. 
Craft & Delivery
Through leadership, shapes the ways of working for teams to elevate the level of craft and quality. Connects the dots between teams and facilitates collaborative processes to provide continuous design direction and innovation. 
Shares expert knowledge of user flows, product features, and underlying technologies across teams and tracks.
Contributes to advancements in Booking.com's design and development principles, standards, components, and practices.
Drives consistent adherence to relevant design standards and principles. 
Support for the wider Trips and Design Foundation strategic objectives to enhance the user experience and drive consistent product experiences on all platforms.
Demonstrates awareness of current and upcoming trends in market, technology and design; Shares this knowledge widely and encourages others to learn. 
Design & Experience Strategy
Aligns with other teams’ missions and objectives through collaboration across teams, disciplines and levels.
Thought partner for Product teams to define, shape, and deliver app and web roadmaps.
Works with Design Managers, Senior Design Managers, Lead Designers and Principal Designers to create, align, and scale design strategy for Trips experiences across platforms. 
Acts as a consistent advocate for end user needs and perspectives in product area discussions, reviews, and critiques. 
Demonstrates fluent understanding of track area's business models and strategies; Actively contributes to strategy through collaboration with other track leadership and managers. 
Champions adherence and consistency to established design and UX copy standards and guidelines across their area of business at all levels and disciplines. 
Actively engages with other managers and departments in order to improve management processes, contribute to overall performance evaluation and improvement.
B.skilled
5 to 8 years in design management role
8 to 12 years individual contributor design experience, preferably in travel, marketplaces & ecommerce, SaaS, media, retail, etc, in customer-orientated user experience design organizations 
Experience shipping successful products on multiple platforms using scalable frameworks such as design systems and machine learning frameworks.
Demonstrated experience managing other UX related disciplines or managing multidisciplinary individuals and teams 
Extensive knowledge of design processes 
Documented creative ability to develop ideas, flows, designs and propositions to engage customers 
Strong theoretical and practical user-centred design skills 
Experience and knowledge of A/B and multivariate testing processes 
Knowledge of Lean UX, Lean startup, Design Thinking, and dual track agile 
Strong people management skills and ability to deal with complex people issues
Excellent stakeholder management experience
A proven communicator who can influence and cooperate with people at all levels
Strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful
Solution oriented and result driven, analytical skills and data-informed mindset
Bachelor’s degree in Design, HCI, Computer Science, Library Science, or a related field or 5 years of progressively responsible experience in the specialty as equivalent
B.offered
Full relocation support for you and your family (if the case) to move to Amsterdam - one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe. We have fine-tuned this process by successfully relocating 300+ Technology professionals to Amsterdam in the last year alone!
Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real time impact of your work on millions of travellers worldwide
Working in a fast paced and performance driven culture
Opportunity to utilise technical expertise, leadership capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit
Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions
Technical, behavioural and interpersonal competence advancement via on-the-job opportunities, experimental projects, hackathons, conferences and active community participation
Competitive compensation and benefits package and some great added perks of working in the home city of Booking.com
We value Diversity of all types and in an open, dynamic workplace. This has been a pillar at Booking.com since day one, and something we continue to strongly believe in and build today.
Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Engineering Manager – Mobile
Who are we?
At Booking.com, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world. We began by taking hotel bookings online over 20 years ago and we’ve been shaping the travel industry ever since. Today, we’re building a platform that connects all parts of the trip – from accommodation to transport, tickets, tours and more.
From our HQ in Manchester, our Transportation team helps people get where they want to go, anywhere in the world. Whether customers want the freedom of a car, the ease of a taxi or the economy of public transport, we make it all possible.
This role is for one of our Apps teams, owning the apps for the RentalCars brand and the car rental section of the Booking.com apps. You will be leading a multi-disciplinary team with backend, Android, and iOS developers to achieve our mission to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. 
Our team is passionate about helping people travel. They see challenges as opportunities. And they’re always ready for change.
  Where we are going
Frictionless customer experience driven by data, machine learning and AI
Cloud by default with continuous delivery, infrastructure as code, and automation at our core
Domain-based SOA ecosystem organised around Product
Cross-functional agile teams who own their products and operate in a DevOps environment
Great engineering practices with a focus on TDD and BDD principles, pair & mob programming, and a strong focus on product metrics and non-functional requirements at the beginning rather than an afterthought

Organised
Ethical
Deliver when we say we will
Leadership
Committed
Trust
Genuine
Proactive

We are looking for a superb and enthusiastic Engineering Manager who will lead an agile team to push the boundaries on engineering brilliant solutions and contribute to shaping our new future. We expect you to have the energy and passion to deliver using a whole range of technologies and have a solid understanding of engineering principles. We also expect you to take the lead and line manage a team of Engineers. As a minimum, we expect all our Engineering Leads to have:
Highly proficient in technical leadership
Good communicator, able to explain technical priorities to non technical people
Solid understanding of building robust and resilient systems
Strong focus on delivery management
Proficient in the use of design and architectural principles and patterns
Quality first mind-set for writing code using techniques such as TDD & BDD
Solid experience of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery/Deployment
Good understanding of security principles
Solid understanding of Agile principles & practices as well as DevOps
  Other beneficial skills
Commercial experience in an e-commerce background and A/B testing
CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GoCD, Spinnaker, CircleCI)
Cloud technologies such as AWS and container technologies such as Kubernetes
Experience developing for mobile applications platforms (Android & iOS) using architectural patterns such as MVVM & MVP
Experience developing back-end services and REST/JSON APIs with technologies such as SpringBoot or Spring MVC
  What we offer in return
A great office to work in the heart of Manchester
A competitive salary, bonus and shares scheme
Great facilities including subsidised canteen and Starbucks, free breakfast & fruit, cycle hub, and break out spaces
An exciting and dynamic place to work
A thriving community of App engineers spanning from Manchester to London and Amsterdam

Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) is the world leader in online travel and related services, provided to customers and partners in over 220 countries and territories through six primary consumer-facing brands - Booking.com, KAYAK, priceline, agoda.com, Rentalcars.com, and OpenTable. The mission of Booking Holdings is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. During 2019, the Company had consolidated revenues and net income of $15.1 billion and $4.9 billion, respectively, and a current market value of approximately $60 billion.
About the Role
Booking Holdings is looking for a Senior Program Manager to support the development and execution of our Center of Excellence at Bangalore, India.  The Bangalore COE is a key enabler of our global talent strategy for several technology functions such as Cybersecurity, Fraud monitoring/analytics, IT etc. 
A key enabler of success is the establishment of strong program management capabilities and solutions in the Bangalore COE organization as well as the COE Program team.
The Senior Program Manager role is responsible for leading various workstreams that are focused on the “build” and the “run” of the Bangalore COE and the COE Program team. This would involve strong project/program management capabilities, executing strategic initiatives, working with and coaching various functional teams, establishing new processes as needed and driving change management.
B.Responsible
Provides technical and/or business consultative leadership for Program Management and Project Management functions
Identifies key projects and programs for the India COE. Ensures and supports successful implementation of various programs; Monitors program delivery and provides coaching, counseling, and motivation to maximize engagement with key stakeholders 
Partners with third-party vendors as needed to drive program execution. Coordinates with vendor teams to track SLAs, OLAs, new services/headcount additions, contract governance etc. 
Creates strong business cases through robust assumption gathering and messaging that articulates the value propositions of a particular program / project
Responsible for the effective management of the life cycle of all projects from start to end
Proactively identifies and provides input into the development and improvement of Project Management strategies, policies, procedures, standards, methods including tools and templates
Prepares, maintains and presents timely and comprehensive activity/progress/status reports to leadership
Assist the leadership to develop and establish a strong Delivery Centers of Excellence (COE) operating model, program roadmap, and build an at-scale world class COE organization
Contribute to overall Delivery Centers of Excellence (COE) strategy and direction setting
Provides support locally within the Bangalore COE organization e.g., summarizing KPIs/metrics, coordinating all-hands and town-halls
Leads functional stakeholder engagement for brand functions utilizing Bangalore/India COE
Provides operations support as and when needed to get things done e.g., local HR/IT/Finance coordination
Introduces / brings new capabilities to the COE organization (e.g., RPA, cross-brand initiatives etc.)
Supports COE leadership team with operations support as appropriate
Plans and executes surveys/dashboards to seek stakeholder feedback on COE effectiveness and improvement areas
New function support 
Drive/coordinate the establishment of a new service line at Bangalore 
Coordinate with TA team on market mapping; coordinate with Comp and Ben team
Engage with brand functions / functional stakeholders
B. Skills
Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Technology, Business Administration or commensurate experience or educational background. 
Substantial knowledge (5+ years) managing talent sourcing projects for Fortune 500 companies and/or experience of working (or managing) with IT outsourcing/BPO vendors is an added plus
Expertise in technology, managed complex IT or Product portfolios. BPO/Global Business Service/Shared Service setup and operations. Setting up Centers to deliver on a specific technical expertise. 
Superior problem-solving skills, leadership qualities, ability to influence, communications, consulting, and team/interpersonal skills.  Ability to work collaboratively with others from any functional area, background, or location to influence thinking, and gain acceptance.  Ability to comfortably work with both technical and non-technical audiences and to work with and through all levels in an organization.
Outstanding ability to diagnose problems that may be related to process, technology, strategy, or people and to put in place a clear plan to overcome the problem.
Solid financial acumen and ability to develop robust business cases that support new or improved project proposals
International experience:  Self-awareness of communication style and cultural differences.
Consultative style:  Ability to formulate and articulate a perspective and present it in a manner that generates understanding and alignment.
Self-motivated and capable of operating independently with limited oversight.  Strong sense of personal accountability for work tasks. 
Comfortable acting in a role both as individual contributor and influencer 
Comfort dealing with ambiguity and a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment
Travel Required : 10%-25% average during normal circumstances
About BKNG 
Booking Holdings is the world leader in online travel & related services. Our teams work around the clock to build and improve the technology that empowers people to more freely travel across borders, time zones, languages and cultures. At Booking Holdings, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world every day through seamless technology powered by our six major brands: 
Booking.com
KAYAK
priceline
agoda
Rentalcars.com
OpenTable
Through the Booking Holdings brands, we help our customers reach all corners of the earth. Our ability to provide great service rests on how well we understand our diverse customer base, which is why having a diverse team is so important to us. We bring together employees from all walks of life and we are proud to provide the kind of inclusive environment that stimulates innovation, creativity and collaboration.
